bookTitle: Confidence and Connections - Teacher Book 1 Left

notes: Scope/sequence data transcribed from page image review.
Lesson 1-9 objectives validated with OCR from teacher lesson pages.

chapters.title: Nice to Meet You
chapters.grammarFocus: Wh- questions in the simple present with 'to be'; possessive adjectives
chapters.conversationFocus: Make introductions with basic questions and answers
outcomes: Introduce yourself
Give your address and phone number
Give basics on your English class
detailedObjectives: Introduce themselves
Recognize and utilize the alphabet and basic numbers
Give information needed for registration (phone number, address)

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Builds confidence with first-day class exchanges and registration language.
contentAnchors: How do you spell your last name?

chapters.title: That's This Month!
chapters.grammarFocus: Wh- questions in the simple present with 'to be'; possessive adjectives; ordinals
chapters.conversationFocus: Share weekly schedules, talk about parties and events
outcomes: Talk about your week
Share about important holidays
Tell your teacher if you can't come to class
detailedObjectives: Identify dates (ordinal numbers)
Talk about their basic schedule and week
Let their teacher know if they can't come to class

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Fast true/false checks reinforce dates, day order, and attendance phrases.
contentAnchors: I can't come to class today

chapters.title: It's Snowy and Cold
chapters.grammarFocus: Wh- and How questions in the simple present with contractions
outcomes: Talk about the weather
Use weather charts
Compare Celsius and Fahrenheit temperatures
detailedObjectives: Talk about the weather
Compare temperatures with Celsius and Fahrenheit
Read simple weather forecasts

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Memory matching pairs weather vocabulary with practical meaning clues.

chapters.title: It Hurts a Lot!
chapters.grammarFocus: Wh- and Yes/No questions with 'to be'; possessive adjectives
chapters.conversationFocus: Role-play about body parts that hurt
outcomes: Talk about your body
Ask if someone is okay
Talk about what hurts
detailedObjectives: Talk about their body
Talk about their health

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Sentence assembly reinforces short, useful health expressions.

chapters.title: It's New
chapters.grammarFocus: Yes/No questions with 'to be' and 'do'; short answers; a vs an
chapters.conversationFocus: Share about where you live and what it's like
outcomes: Give basics on where you live and what it's like
Ask others about their home
detailedObjectives: Respond to questions with short answers, yes/no
Distinguish when to use singular and plural forms of 'to be' and 'do'
Talk about their home

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Timed responses build quick confidence with yes/no home-description patterns.
contentAnchors: Do you live in a house?

chapters.title: I Like to Play Soccer
chapters.grammarFocus: Wh- questions with 'do' in the simple present; long answers
chapters.conversationFocus: Talk about hobbies and things you do or do not do during free time
outcomes: Share about what you like to do in your free time
Ask what others like to do in their free time
detailedObjectives: Talk about their hobbies
Talk about what they don't like to do

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Spelling common hobby words supports speaking confidence for likes/dislikes.

chapters.title: He Has a Big Family
chapters.grammarFocus: Wh- and How questions in the simple present with 'go'
chapters.conversationFocus: Talk about family members and family trees
outcomes: Talk about your family
Share about where you live and go to school
Ask basic questions about someone's family and life
detailedObjectives: Talk about family members and children
Ask about age and school
Share where family members go to school

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Sorting reinforces family vocabulary, school questions, and common life details together.
contentAnchors: How many children do you have?
Where do they go to school?

chapters.title: Review and Progress Check
outcomes: Review and progress check
detailedObjectives: Demonstrate understanding across lessons 1-7
Complete listening and speaking progress-check tasks
Identify strengths and areas for extra practice

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Odd-one-out quickly checks mixed vocab/grammar before formal progress checks.

chapters.title: Field Trip
outcomes: Field trip communication practice
detailedObjectives: Prepare key questions and phrases before a community visit
Use English with people and places in the community

personalizedGameDraft.whyThisFits: Image-to-phrase matching mirrors real objects and actions students meet outside class.

chapters.title: We Went Out

Ask others about things they have done

chapters.title: I Can Work Part Time
